metadata.title: CVE-2021-42739 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel FireDTVmedia card driver, where the user calls the CA_SEND_MSG ioctl. This flawallows a local user of the host machine to crash the system or escalateprivileges on the system. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42739` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-97-generic - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1').
